Material used.Description: Human embryonic kidney cells transiently transfected with DJ-1 wild-type or mutant constructs.

Readout description.Result Description: DJ-1 D149A mutant showed reduced cleavage by caspase-6 compared to wild-type DJ-1.
DJ-1 L166P mutant showed normal cleavage by caspase-6 but impaired dimerization.

Biological replicates.Description: Number of biological replicates not explicitly mentioned in the provided context.

Technical replicates.Description: Number of technical replicates not explicitly mentioned in the provided context.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 was used as a positive control for proper cleavage by caspase-6.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector or non-cleavable construct was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Not explicitly mentioned in the provided context.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Caspase-6 cleavage efficiency comparable to wild-type DJ-1.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Reduced caspase-6 cleavage efficiency compared to wild-type DJ-1.

Approved assay.Description: Western blot is a commonly used method for studying protein expression and cleavage in the context of Parkinson's disease.
